match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 8 wickets (with 63 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Azhar Ali b Shakib Al Hasan 101 (112b 10x4 0x6 166m) SR: 90.17

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes with the arm-ball. This was angled in with some good extra bounce. Azhar shifts his balance onto the back foot in an attempt to cut it away. It was far too close to play the stroke and Azhar failed to connect. Shakib hits the top of off. His joy may translate as you miss and I hit. Azhar slams his bat on the ground as he trudges back

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 52 (58b 1x4 2x6 80m) SR: 89.65

dismissalComment.html: two wickets in two overs. Bangladesh are clawing their way back into the contest. Haris sinks to one knee and aims for a swipe across the line, slices it high into the air behind the wicket. Mushfiq follows the ball, moves to his left and swallows it. He was hoodwinked by a slower one

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes with the arm-ball. This was angled in with some good extra bounce. Azhar shifts his balance onto the back foot in an attempt to cut it away. It was far too close to play the stroke and Azhar failed to connect. Shakib hits the top of off. His joy may translate as you miss and I hit. Azhar slams his bat on the ground as he trudges back

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: how soft was that? Slower through the air from Shakib, stops on Rizwan who aims to flick it away. But he can only lob it back to the bowler. Make that three wickets in three overs for Bangladesh

bowled em! Sunny breaks into a nice, little jig. Arm-ball arrows in with the angle at 80.8ks, Hafeez skips down the track, does not meet the pitch of the ball and does not connect with his attempted big hit over the leg side. The ball slides in and crashes onto middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Now, Pakistan have been bowled out for 250. This was fired at 92.5ks, Junaid attempts a dinky reverse-sweep but does not connect with it. This darter clatters into middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sami Aslam c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 45 (50b 7x4 0x6 77m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: Aslam has nicked off or has he?. The crowd find their voice again. Pushed through a bit outside off, spins away as well, leaving Aslam prodding. The keeper pouches it. And it is given, though there was no outside edge on that. Aslam did not review. Azhar should have insisted on the review. Actually, replays show that the ball grazed the bottom thumb on its way to Mushfiq

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez b Arafat Sunny 4 (15b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 26.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled em! Sunny breaks into a nice, little jig. Arm-ball arrows in with the angle at 80.8ks, Hafeez skips down the track, does not meet the pitch of the ball and does not connect with his attempted big hit over the leg side. The ball slides in and crashes onto middle and leg

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan c & b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: how soft was that? Slower through the air from Shakib, stops on Rizwan who aims to flick it away. But he can only lob it back to the bowler. Make that three wickets in three overs for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: Crude slog from Fawad, superb take from Nasir. It had Mash applauding. Length-ball, Alam goes low to swipe it away, does so though without much power. Nasir runs across to his left from deep square leg, completes the catch and tumbles!

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Wahab Riaz c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 7 (8b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Wahab picks out Mashrafe at cover. This was a length-ball outside off, Wahab backs away, drives uppishly and hits it straight to Mash, who did not even budge

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Umar Gul run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Arafat Sunny) 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: A huge mix-up and Umar Gul gone for a duck on his return to international cricket. He hangs back and pushes it to short cover. Shakib collects the ball quickly and throws it to the bowlers'. Sunny gathers it and flicks it onto the stumps. Gul is well short after a communication breakdown

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Saad Nasim c Taskin Ahmed b Rubel Hossain 22 (24b 3x4 0x6 30m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: Rubel has his hands aloft in joy. Holes out to Taskin at mid-off. This was fuller and outside off, Nasim looks to loft over the covers. End up mistiming it straight to mid-off

headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Junaid Khan b Arafat Sunny 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Now, Pakistan have been bowled out for 250. This was fired at 92.5ks, Junaid attempts a dinky reverse-sweep but does not connect with it. This darter clatters into middle and leg

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar not out 127 (110b 13x4 6x6 182m) SR: 115.45

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Junaid Khan 64 (76b 8x4 1x6 111m) SR: 84.21

dismissalComment.html: Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back

Junaid takes out Mahmudullah. They check for a no-ball, this one is a legal one, though. Fullish and jags in on off, he seeks to drive it through the covers. The ball sneaks through the bat-pad gap and clatters the top of off

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Junaid Khan 64 (76b 8x4 1x6 111m) SR: 84.21

dismissalComment.html: Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Junaid Khan 4 (10b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Junaid takes out Mahmudullah. They check for a no-ball, this one is a legal one, though. Fullish and jags in on off, he seeks to drive it through the covers. The ball sneaks through the bat-pad gap and clatters the top of off

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh sweep the series 3-0! Mushfiq roars, has his hands aloft in joy and then hugs Sarkar. Beaming smiles in the Bangladesh camp. Junaid errs on the pads, tickled away to the right of short fine

commentPostTextItems.html: Hope you enjoyed our coverage as much as we did bringing it to you. Make sure you catch up with Karthik's report. We will be back on Friday for the one-off T20. Until then, this is Deivarayan Muthu saying buh-bye.

Tamim Iqbal, Man of the Series: I am enjoying my batting and that is the main thing. Thanks to the team, special thanks to Mushfiqur and Mashrafe. The best part of the series is that we were dominant.
Soumya Sarkar is the Man of the Match
Mashrafe Mortaza, Bangladesh captain: The way the boys are playing, it is pleasing. This is a good team. Soumya [Sarkar] was brilliant today. We will now focus on the T20 and then Tests.

Azhar Ali, Pakistan captain: First of all I would like to congratulate Bangladesh. They played good cricket. We played well in patches but we could not put it together. As everybody knows, the senior players have left. The youngsters have to stand up and we have to pull our heads together. We have some experienced guys for T20s and Tests. We will put in a better performance.
Prashanth: "Amazing turn around.. Ban took 16years to for 2nd win against Pak and now within a week have won 3 against Pak. Looks like interesting times for Bangladesh cricket. Go on!!"
9:50pm: Big celebrations in the Bangladesh camp. After wrapping up the series in the second ODI, Mash said that the job is yet to be finished. They have done it now, making it 3-0.

Tamim and Sarkar set up the chase, courtesy a brisk 145-run partnership for the first wicket. Sarkar was the chief aggressor this time, crunching 127 off 110 balls, his maiden century. He stayed there till the end as Bangladesh surged to a famous series win. Pakistan were sloppy with the ball and sloppier on the field. A difficult journey beckons for the visitors.

ASM Jahangir: "The dream run in Bangladesh cricket continues. What a performance once again!! A treat to watch what the young Soumya Sarker displayed with his bat. Hats off to Soumya, Tamim and Mushfique and congrats to the team for the confidence with which they played. Keep up the tempo and the ranking will go up in no time."
Kiran: "Not just sweeping the series 3-0. They were quite convincing in all the three matches."

Mushfiqu Rahim: It is great moment for Bangladesh cricket. All the credit goes to the boys. They have improved a lot and the boys have put their hands up. I want to keep going. The boys are confident and ready for the T20s and Tests.

commentTextItems.html: free-hit. Mushfiq nips down the track, Junaid shortens his length outside off and delivers a bumpy ball, which is carved over backward point, third man runs to his right to mop it up in the deep
length on middle, Mushfiq skips down the track and drills it it over the bowler, it just scudded away to the boundary. To add to Pakistan's woes, Junaid has overstepped
on a good length and angling away outside off, Mushfiq can't connect with the dab to third man now. Beaten
pitched up and outside off, driven in front of mid-off for an urgent single

commentPostTextItems.html: Charbel: "Bangladesh to win 3-0 with Shakib only facing 31 balls all series! Unbelievable!"

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: length outside off, Sarkar shuffles across off and manipulates it behind square leg with a flip of those wrists
back of a length and outside off, use of finesse again as Mushfiq unfurls another nifty dab to third man
Sarkar makes room outside leg, Gul follows him. He adjusts and chops it towards third man
length outside off, eased to third man with an open face
shortish and outside off, he rides the bounce and guides it down to deep third man
fractionally back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq waits on it and guides it through the vacant slip cordon. Babar hauls the ball in the deep

commentPostTextItems.html: Dipanjan Mitra: "What a knock from Soumya..whoa...take a bow young man. "

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Zulfiqar Babar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zulfiqar Babar player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: length ball on middle and leg, slowy at 115ks, whipped away to long-on
anddd again! Length ball, he nips down the track, unleashes an almighty swing and sends it soaring over long-on

resounding crack as he met the ball. Dragged short and wide outside off, he fetches it from there and smacks a pull to the cow corner boundary, bisecting the two men in the deep. It was the slower one at 119.3ks, but Sarkar manufactured his own pace
length on middle and leg, Sarkar drills it to the left of Umar Gul. The bowler had no chance. Sarkar is upping the ante after reaching three figures
on a length and outside off, steered away to third man with an angled bat
pushed through on the leg stump, he takes it on the pad. This was going down leg

headshotImage.caption: Zulfiqar Babar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zulfiqar Babar player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: quicker at 94ks on middle and leg, he saunters down the track and thwacks it over long-off for another six
shortish and spinning outside leg, mishit pull to short fine
drifts on the pads, tucked to midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sami Aslam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sami Aslam c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 45 (50b 7x4 0x6 77m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: Aslam has nicked off or has he?. The crowd find their voice again. Pushed through a bit outside off, spins away as well, leaving Aslam prodding. The keeper pouches it. And it is given, though there was no outside edge on that. Aslam did not review. Azhar should have insisted on the review. Actually, replays show that the ball grazed the bottom thumb on its way to Mushfiq

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez b Arafat Sunny 4 (15b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 26.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled em! Sunny breaks into a nice, little jig. Arm-ball arrows in with the angle at 80.8ks, Hafeez skips down the track, does not meet the pitch of the ball and does not connect with his attempted big hit over the leg side. The ball slides in and crashes onto middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Azhar Ali b Shakib Al Hasan 101 (112b 10x4 0x6 166m) SR: 90.17

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes with the arm-ball. This was angled in with some good extra bounce. Azhar shifts his balance onto the back foot in an attempt to cut it away. It was far too close to play the stroke and Azhar failed to connect. Shakib hits the top of off. His joy may translate as you miss and I hit. Azhar slams his bat on the ground as he trudges back

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 52 (58b 1x4 2x6 80m) SR: 89.65

dismissalComment.html: two wickets in two overs. Bangladesh are clawing their way back into the contest. Haris sinks to one knee and aims for a swipe across the line, slices it high into the air behind the wicket. Mushfiq follows the ball, moves to his left and swallows it. He was hoodwinked by a slower one

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan c & b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: how soft was that? Slower through the air from Shakib, stops on Rizwan who aims to flick it away. But he can only lob it back to the bowler. Make that three wickets in three overs for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: Crude slog from Fawad, superb take from Nasir. It had Mash applauding. Length-ball, Alam goes low to swipe it away, does so though without much power. Nasir runs across to his left from deep square leg, completes the catch and tumbles!

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Wahab Riaz c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 7 (8b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Wahab picks out Mashrafe at cover. This was a length-ball outside off, Wahab backs away, drives uppishly and hits it straight to Mash, who did not even budge

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Umar Gul run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Arafat Sunny) 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: A huge mix-up and Umar Gul gone for a duck on his return to international cricket. He hangs back and pushes it to short cover. Shakib collects the ball quickly and throws it to the bowlers'. Sunny gathers it and flicks it onto the stumps. Gul is well short after a communication breakdown

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Saad Nasim c Taskin Ahmed b Rubel Hossain 22 (24b 3x4 0x6 30m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: Rubel has his hands aloft in joy. Holes out to Taskin at mid-off. This was fuller and outside off, Nasim looks to loft over the covers. End up mistiming it straight to mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Junaid Khan b Arafat Sunny 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Now, Pakistan have been bowled out for 250. This was fired at 92.5ks, Junaid attempts a dinky reverse-sweep but does not connect with it. This darter clatters into middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Junaid Khan 64 (76b 8x4 1x6 111m) SR: 84.21

dismissalComment.html: Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar not out 127 (110b 13x4 6x6 182m) SR: 115.45

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Junaid Khan 4 (10b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Junaid takes out Mahmudullah. They check for a no-ball, this one is a legal one, though. Fullish and jags in on off, he seeks to drive it through the covers. The ball sneaks through the bat-pad gap and clatters the top of off

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim not out 49 (43b 6x4 0x6 57m) SR: 113.95

milestones.description: Soumya Sarkar has broken the record for most runs in boundaries (88) in an innings in ODIs for BAN, going past Shakib's 78
Tamim Iqbal has scored 35 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record
Tamim Iqbal has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2014-15

stories.title: Mashrafe pleased with Bangladesh's fightback
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza has said the way his side fought back against Pakistan in the third ODI was an indicator of their growth as a team

image.caption: The Bangladesh team celebrate their 3-0 series win over Pakistan
image.longCaption: The Bangladesh team celebrate their 3-0 series win over Pakistan, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, April 22, 2015

stories.title: Soumya graduates to the next level
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Soumya Sarkar graduates to the next level
stories.summary: Soumya Sarkar's longest ODI innings before today was 58-balls long. Today, once he survived that period, he knew he had to make it big

image.caption: The Bangladesh team celebrate their 3-0 series win over Pakistan
image.longCaption: The Bangladesh team celebrate their 3-0 series win over Pakistan, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, April 22, 2015

stories.title: Azhar rues lost momentum
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Azhar Ali, the Pakistan captain, has said his team lost grip of the third and final ODI when he and Haris Sohail got out during the batting Powerplay

image.caption: Azhar Ali celebrates after scoring his maiden ODI hundred
image.longCaption: Azhar Ali celebrates after scoring his maiden ODI hundred, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, April 22, 2015

stories.title: Prudent Mashrafe's street-smart moves
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Not many Bangladesh captains could have got away with the kind of tactics Mashrafe Mortaza employed but the side's efficiency in the field showed that he is a prudent leader

image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza appeals for an lbw, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, April 19, 2015

stories.title: A rare hundred by a Pakistan captain
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur

stories.summary: Azhar Ali became the eighth Pakistan captain to score an ODI hundred and the first in five years

stories.title: Sarkar ton powers Bangladesh to 3-0
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Soumya Sarkar blasted a maiden ODI hundred and put on 145 with Tamim Iqbal as Bangladesh wrapped up a 3-0 series whitewash in emphatic fashion

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar fifty helped Bangladesh get off to a good start
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar fifty helped Bangladesh get off to a good start, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, April 22, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh well placed to complete whitewash
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh well placed to complete whitewash
stories.summary: Bangladesh are allowed to feel some Schadenfreude when hearing Pakistan ask for more time to develop as a team. It used to be Bangladesh's go-to phrase for years

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal is ecstatic after the historic win
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal is ecstatic after the historic win, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, April 19, 2015
